documentation:
AAWS Sever Migration Service

This is the AWS Sever Migration Service API Reference. It provides descriptions, syntax, and usage examples for each of the actions and data types for the AWS Sever Migration Service (AWS SMS). The topic for each action shows the Query API request parameters and the XML response. You can also view the XML request elements in the WSDL.

Alternatively, you can use one of the AWS SDKs to access an API that's tailored to the programming language or platform that you're using. For more information, see AWS SDKs.

To learn more about the Server Migration Service, see the following resources:

  • AWS Sever Migration Service product page

  • AWS Sever Migration Service User Guide

CreateApp.documentation: Creates an application. An application consists of one or more server groups. Each server group contain one or more servers.
CreateApp.name: CreateApp

CreateReplicationJob.documentation: Creates a replication job. The replication job schedules periodic replication runs to replicate your server to AWS. Each replication run creates an Amazon Machine Image (AMI).
CreateReplicationJob.name: CreateReplicationJob

DeleteApp.documentation: Deletes an existing application. Optionally deletes the launched stack associated with the application and all AWS SMS replication jobs for servers in the application.
DeleteApp.name: DeleteApp

DeleteAppLaunchConfiguration.documentation: Deletes existing launch configuration for an application.
DeleteAppLaunchConfiguration.name: DeleteAppLaunchConfiguration

DeleteAppReplicationConfiguration.documentation: Deletes existing replication configuration for an application.
DeleteAppReplicationConfiguration.name: DeleteAppReplicationConfiguration

DeleteReplicationJob.documentation:
Deletes the specified replication job.

After you delete a replication job, there are no further replication runs. AWS deletes the contents of the Amazon S3 bucket used to store AWS SMS artifacts. The AMIs created by the replication runs are not deleted.
DeleteReplicationJob.name: DeleteReplicationJob

DeleteServerCatalog.documentation: Deletes all servers from your server catalog.
DeleteServerCatalog.name: DeleteServerCatalog

DisassociateConnector.documentation:
Disassociates the specified connector from AWS SMS.

After you disassociate a connector, it is no longer available to support replication jobs.
DisassociateConnector.name: DisassociateConnector

GenerateChangeSet.documentation: Generates a target change set for a currently launched stack and writes it to an Amazon S3 object in the customer’s Amazon S3 bucket.
GenerateChangeSet.name: GenerateChangeSet

GenerateTemplate.documentation: Generates an Amazon CloudFormation template based on the current launch configuration and writes it to an Amazon S3 object in the customer’s Amazon S3 bucket.
GenerateTemplate.name: GenerateTemplate

GetAppLaunchConfiguration.documentation: Retrieves the application launch configuration associated with an application.
GetAppLaunchConfiguration.name: GetAppLaunchConfiguration

GetAppReplicationConfiguration.documentation: Retrieves an application replication configuration associatd with an application.
GetAppReplicationConfiguration.name: GetAppReplicationConfiguration

GetConnectors.documentation: Describes the connectors registered with the AWS SMS.
GetConnectors.name: GetConnectors

GetReplicationJobs.documentation: Describes the specified replication job or all of your replication jobs.
GetReplicationJobs.name: GetReplicationJobs

GetReplicationRuns.documentation: Describes the replication runs for the specified replication job.
GetReplicationRuns.name: GetReplicationRuns

GetServers.documentation:
Describes the servers in your server catalog.

Before you can describe your servers, you must import them using ImportServerCatalog.
GetServers.name: GetServers

ImportServerCatalog.documentation:
Gathers a complete list of on-premises servers. Connectors must be installed and monitoring all servers that you want to import.

This call returns immediately, but might take additional time to retrieve all the servers.
ImportServerCatalog.name: ImportServerCatalog

ListApps.documentation: Returns a list of summaries for all applications.
ListApps.name: ListApps

PutAppLaunchConfiguration.documentation: Creates a launch configuration for an application.
PutAppLaunchConfiguration.name: PutAppLaunchConfiguration

PutAppReplicationConfiguration.documentation: Creates or updates a replication configuration for an application.
PutAppReplicationConfiguration.name: PutAppReplicationConfiguration

StartOnDemandReplicationRun.documentation:
Starts an on-demand replication run for the specified replication job. This replication run starts immediately. This replication run is in addition to the ones already scheduled.

There is a limit on the number of on-demand replications runs you can request in a 24-hour period.
StartOnDemandReplicationRun.name: StartOnDemandReplicationRun

UpdateReplicationJob.documentation: Updates the specified settings for the specified replication job.
UpdateReplicationJob.name: UpdateReplicationJob

latestReplicationTime.documentation: Timestamp of the application's most recent successful replication.

launchDetails.documentation: Details about the latest launch of the application.

launchStatusMessage.documentation: A message related to the launch status of the application.

replicationStatusMessage.documentation: A message related to the replication status of the application.

roleName.documentation: Name of the service role in the customer's account used by AWS SMS.

statusMessage.documentation: A message related to the status of the application

totalServerGroups.documentation: Number of server groups present in the application.

totalServers.documentation: Number of servers present in the application.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure idempotency of application creation.

roleName.documentation: Name of service role in customer's account to be used by AWS SMS.

serverGroups.documentation: List of server groups to include in the application.

tags.documentation: List of tags to be associated with the application.

serverGroups.documentation: List of server groups included in the application.

tags.documentation: List of taags associated with the application.

encrypted.documentation: When true, the replication job produces encrypted AMIs. See also KmsKeyId below.

frequency.documentation: The time between consecutive replication runs, in hours.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
KMS key ID for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. Can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to KMS key alias

If encrypted is true but a KMS key id is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for EBS is used.

licenseType.documentation: The license type to be used for the AMI created by a successful replication run.

numberOfRecentAmisToKeep.documentation: The maximum number of SMS-created AMIs to retain. The oldest will be deleted once the maximum number is reached and a new AMI is created.

roleName.documentation: The name of the IAM role to be used by the AWS SMS.

replicationJobId.documentation: The unique identifier of the replication job.

appId.documentation: ID of the application associated with the launch configuration.
ID of the application associated with the replication configuration.

forceStopAppReplication.documentation: While deleting the application, stop all replication jobs corresponding to the servers in the application.

forceTerminateApp.documentation: While deleting the application, terminate the stack corresponding to the application.

appId.documentation: ID of the application associated with the change set.
ID of the application associated with the Amazon CloudFormation template.

templateFormat.documentation: Format for generating the Amazon CloudFormation template.

appId.documentation: ID of the application associated with the launch configuration.

roleName.documentation: Name of the service role in the customer's account that Amazon CloudFormation uses to launch the application.

serverGroupLaunchConfigurations.documentation: List of launch configurations for server groups in this application.

appId.documentation: ID of the application associated with the replication configuration.

serverGroupReplicationConfigurations.documentation: Replication configurations associated with server groups in this application.

appId.documentation: ID of the application whose information is being retrieved.

serverGroups.documentation: List of server groups belonging to the application.

tags.documentation: List of tags associated with the application.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. The default value is 50. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.
The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.
The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. The default value is 50. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.
The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. The default value is 50. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

lastModifiedOn.documentation: The time when the server was last modified.

nextToken.documentation: The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

LaunchDetails.documentation: Details about the latest launch of an application.

latestLaunchTime.documentation: Latest time this application was launched successfully.

stackId.documentation: Identifier of the latest stack launched for this application.

stackName.documentation: Name of the latest stack launched for this application.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. The default value is 50. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.
The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

appId.documentation: ID of the application associated with the launch configuration.

roleName.documentation: Name of service role in the customer's account that Amazon CloudFormation uses to launch the application.

serverGroupLaunchConfigurations.documentation: Launch configurations for server groups in the application.

appId.documentation: ID of the application tassociated with the replication configuration.

serverGroupReplicationConfigurations.documentation: Replication configurations for server groups in the application.

encrypted.documentation: Whether the replication job should produce encrypted AMIs or not. See also KmsKeyId below.

frequency.documentation: The time between consecutive replication runs, in hours.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
KMS key ID for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. Can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to KMS key alias

If encrypted is true but a KMS key id is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for EBS is used.

latestAmiId.documentation: The ID of the latest Amazon Machine Image (AMI).

licenseType.documentation: The license type to be used for the AMI created by a successful replication run.

nextReplicationRunStartTime.documentation: The start time of the next replication run.

numberOfRecentAmisToKeep.documentation: Number of recent AMIs to keep in the customer's account for a replication job. By default the value is set to zero, meaning that all AMIs are kept.

roleName.documentation: The name of the IAM role to be used by the Server Migration Service.

statusMessage.documentation: The description of the current status of the replication job.

ReplicationJobNotFoundException.documentation: The specified replication job does not exist.

amiId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) from the replication run.

completedTime.documentation: The completion time of the last replication run.

encrypted.documentation: Whether the replication run should produce encrypted AMI or not. See also KmsKeyId below.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
KMS key ID for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. Can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to KMS key alias

If encrypted is true but a KMS key id is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for EBS is used.

scheduledStartTime.documentation: The start time of the next replication run.

stageDetails.documentation: Details of the current stage of the replication run.

statusMessage.documentation: The description of the current status of the replication job.

ReplicationRunLimitExceededException.documentation: You have exceeded the number of on-demand replication runs you can request in a 24-hour period.

ReplicationRunStageDetails.documentation: Details of the current stage of a replication run.

stage.documentation: String describing the current stage of a replication run.

stageProgress.documentation: String describing the progress of the current stage of a replication run.

S3Location.documentation: Location of the Amazon S3 object in the customer's account.

replicationJobTerminated.documentation: Indicates whether the replication job is deleted or failed.

serverList.documentation: List of servers belonging to a server group.

launchOrder.documentation: Launch order of servers in the server group.

serverGroupId.documentation: Identifier of the server group the launch configuration is associated with.

serverLaunchConfigurations.documentation: Launch configuration for servers in the server group.

serverGroupId.documentation: Identifier of the server group this replication configuration is associated with.

serverReplicationConfigurations.documentation: Replication configuration for servers in the server group.

associatePublicIpAddress.documentation: If true, a publicly accessible IP address is created when launching the server.

ec2KeyName.documentation: Name of the EC2 SSH Key to be used for connecting to the launched server.

instanceType.documentation: Instance type to be used for launching the server.

logicalId.documentation: Logical ID of the server in the Amazon CloudFormation template.

securityGroup.documentation: Identifier of the security group that applies to the launched server.

server.documentation: Identifier of the server the launch configuration is associated with.

subnet.documentation: Identifier of the subnet the server should be launched into.

userData.documentation: Location of the user-data script to be executed when launching the server.

vpc.documentation: Identifier of the VPC the server should be launched into.

server.documentation: Identifier of the server this replication configuration is associated with.

encrypted.documentation: When true, the replication job produces encrypted AMIs. See also KmsKeyId below.

frequency.documentation: Frequency of creating replication jobs for the server.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
KMS key ID for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. Can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to KMS key alias

If encrypted is true but a KMS key id is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for EBS is used.

licenseType.documentation: License type for creating a replication job for the server.

numberOfRecentAmisToKeep.documentation: Number of recent AMIs to keep when creating a replication job for this server.

seedTime.documentation: Seed time for creating a replication job for the server.

appId.documentation: ID of the application to stop replicating.

Tag.documentation: A label that can be assigned to an application.

UnauthorizedOperationException.documentation: You lack permissions needed to perform this operation. Check your IAM policies, and ensure that you are using the correct access keys.

roleName.documentation: Name of the service role in the customer's account used by AWS SMS.

serverGroups.documentation: List of server groups in the application to update.

tags.documentation: List of tags to associate with the application.

serverGroups.documentation: List of updated server groups in the application.

tags.documentation: List of tags associated with the application.

encrypted.documentation: When true, the replication job produces encrypted AMIs . See also KmsKeyId below.

frequency.documentation: The time between consecutive replication runs, in hours.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
KMS key ID for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. Can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to KMS key alias

If encrypted is true but a KMS key id is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for EBS is used.

licenseType.documentation: The license type to be used for the AMI created by a successful replication run.

nextReplicationRunStartTime.documentation: The start time of the next replication run.

numberOfRecentAmisToKeep.documentation: The maximum number of SMS-created AMIs to retain. The oldest will be deleted once the maximum number is reached and a new AMI is created.

roleName.documentation: The name of the IAM role to be used by AWS SMS.

UserData.documentation: A script that runs on first launch of an Amazon EC2 instance. Used for configuring the server during launch.

s3Location.documentation: Amazon S3 location of the user-data script.

vmPath.documentation: The VM folder path in the vCenter Server virtual machine inventory tree.
